docs.snippet: The Wax Shipping Administration has completed its part of the transportation of war brides and children from Europe to the United States and those still to be brought here will be handled exclusively on Army transports, it was announced yesterday at...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Wax Shipping Administration has completed its part of the transportation of war brides and children from Europe to the United States and those still to be brought here will be handled exclusively on Army transports, it was announced yesterday at regional WSA headquarters, 45 Broadway.

headline.main: WSA ENDS SAILINGS FOR GI FAMILIES; Army Transports Take Over Transfer of War Brides From Overseas Ports

docs.snippet: The House rejected, 211 to 64, yesterday a Republican move for approval of the Senate-passed OPA bill and the measure was sent to conference, where efforts will be made to fashion a pricecontrol law acceptable to President Truman.

headline.main: MORE CHILD CENTERS SLATED FOR URUGUAY

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 15--For perhaps the first time in her history, Uruguay has established controls over the foreign and domestic press. She has made it an offense to send news referring to "neighboring" countries or to transmit in or outside...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 15--For perhaps the first time in her history, Uruguay has established controls over the foreign and domestic press. She has made it an offense to send news referring to "neighboring" countries or to transmit in or outside Uruguay news that the Government, as sole arbiter, decides is false or damaging.
docs.abstract: Uruguay passport curbs violate internatl practice

headline.main: URUGUAY DECREES CONTROL OF NEWS; Internal or Foreign Reports on Neighbors Made an Offense if Judged False, Damaging Foreign Demand Unlikely Kept Liberal by Press

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 17. (AP)-- Representatives of the American Republics approved and referred to their governments today a proposal that they formally agree not to intervene in one another's affairs.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 17. (AP)-- Representatives of the American Republics approved and referred to their governments today a proposal that they formally agree not to intervene in one another's affairs.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 18--The Civilian Production Administration announced today that it has dropped civilian polo and "T" shirts from the list of knitted outerwear garments for which cotton sale yarn must be set aside. The announcement was made in...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 18--The Civilian Production Administration announced today that it has dropped civilian polo and "T" shirts from the list of knitted outerwear garments for which cotton sale yarn must be set aside. The announcement was made in connection with issuance by CPA of amended regulations covering production and distribution of cotton sale yarn during the third quarter.
docs.abstract: CPA rules cotton sale yarn no longer will be set aside for knitted civilian polo and T shirts
